Description: Fragment of neck and oval handle to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine red-brown; cream slip. Circular stamp with rose symbol.
Production date: 131 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Nikasagoras. From a die similar to that of Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0185.05.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (196)
